title.narrative: 3.2 PARENTAL AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: Enhanced skills and capacity of parents and community members to contribute to the school environment for boys and girls to access and complete preschool, primary and demand more secondary education opportunities in targeted areas., which contributes to Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2019, boys and girls, especially from rural indigenous communities, will access and complete preschool and primary and will have more opportunities to complete secondary education.

sector.narrative: Curriculum and/or training materials on gender roles and practices
Provision of training of other education staff excluding teachers (e.g. inspectors, district, ministry staff, etc.)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced skills and capacity of parents and community members to contribute to the school environment for boys and girls toaccess and complete preschool, primary and demand more secondary education opportunities in targeted areas.

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s work with school management committees was beneficial for the education sector, particularly during COVID-19. These committees promoted women leadership and greater involvement in school decisions. Community engagement for safe return to school was important to ensure biosafety protocols, school meals and learning materials distribution. UNICEF&39;s support contributed to a more participatory implementation of emergency response plans and increased collaboration between families and schools.It will be a critical challenge to increase capacity of school management committees to support learning processes and rapport towards learning and teachers in order to improve education outcomes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2022
